name: influentially

in a way that has a lot of influence on someone or something: She contributed influentially both as a player and a team leader. The standard theory has been criticized most influentially by Chang and Hofmeister.
More examplesFewer examplesAs a young man, he covered conflicts in Northern Ireland, South Africa, and, very influentially, Vietnam. She has written very influentially about the role of social media in modern society.The poem soon attracted many admirers, including, perhaps most influentially, T.S. Eliot.
